ru.jango.j0util

Class BmpUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.jango.j0util.BmpUtil

  • public class BmpUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class with methods for working with Bitmap's. Mostly for scaling.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  BmpUtil.ScaleType

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE

        public static final int MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE
        Maximum texture size, witch Android could handle. That is, maximum Bitmap size, witch won't through OutOfMemoryError.

        Actually maximum texture size for now is 2048x2048, but here was chosen 2000x2000 just in case.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public BmpUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • isTooBig

        public static boolean isTooBig(byte[] data)
        Checks, if the passed image's dimensions are greater, than acceptable.
        Parameters:
        data - raw (not decoded) image data as byte array
        See Also:
        MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE

      • subsampleToMaxSize

        public static byte[] subsampleToMaxSize(byte[] data)
        If passed image's dimensions are greater than acceptable (than MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE), scales image down and converts it back into byte array.

        ATTENTION: conversion back into byte array uses Bitmap.compress(android.graphics.Bitmap.CompressFormat, int, java.io.OutputStream), that is very long running operation.

        ATTENTION: scaling is done by BitmapFactory.Options.inSampleSize, witch means that resulting image wouldn't be exactly MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE*MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE, likely it would be much smaller. It may be batter to use scale(byte[], ru.jango.j0util.BmpUtil.ScaleType, int, int).

        Parameters:
        data - raw (not decoded) image data as byte array
        Returns:
        raw (not decoded) image data with fixed dimensions, or original byte array
        See Also:
        MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE, bmpToByte(android.graphics.Bitmap, android.graphics.Bitmap.CompressFormat, int), scale(byte[], ru.jango.j0util.BmpUtil.ScaleType, int, int)

      • subsample

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap subsample(byte[] data,
                                BmpUtil.ScaleType scaleType,
                                int w,
                                int h)
        Scales image according to the passed params. Scaling is done by BitmapFactory.Options.inSampleSize, witch means:
        - scaling would be done very fast
        - resulting image wouldn't exactly match the passed params, but would be as close to them as possible
        - method can only scale image down, not expand

        Also checks bounds to be smaller than MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE.

        Parameters:
        data - raw (not decoded) image data as byte array
        scaleType - scaling option
        w - target width
        h - target height
        Returns:
        decoded and scaled bitmap
        See Also:
        BmpUtil.ScaleType.PROPORTIONAL_CROP, BmpUtil.ScaleType.PROPORTIONAL_FIT, BmpUtil.ScaleType.FIT_XY

      • scale

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap scale(byte[] data,
                            BmpUtil.ScaleType scaleType,
                            int w,
                            int h)
        Scales image according to the passed params. First subsamples image data and then scales image with Bitmap.createScaledBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap, int, int, boolean). Also checks bounds to be smaller than MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE.
        Parameters:
        data - raw (not decoded) image data as byte array
        scaleType - scaling option
        w - target width
        h - target height
        Returns:
        decoded and scaled bitmap
        See Also:
        subsample(byte[], ru.jango.j0util.BmpUtil.ScaleType, int, int), BmpUtil.ScaleType.PROPORTIONAL_CROP, BmpUtil.ScaleType.PROPORTIONAL_FIT, BmpUtil.ScaleType.FIT_XY

      • bmpToByte

        public static byte[] bmpToByte(android.graphics.Bitmap bmp,
               android.graphics.Bitmap.CompressFormat format,
               int quality)
        Converts image to byte array.

        ATTENTION: image conversion is done by compression, witch is very long running operation.

        Parameters:
        bmp - original bitmap
        format - compress format
        quality - compress quality
        Returns:
        compress image as byte array
        See Also:
        Bitmap.compress(android.graphics.Bitmap.CompressFormat, int, java.io.OutputStream)

      • extractSize

        public static android.graphics.Point extractSize(byte[] data)
        Looks through the byte array and calculates size of the picture inside it. Operation is very fast, as no actual decoding will be done.

      • genBFOptions

        protected static android.graphics.BitmapFactory.Options genBFOptions(BmpUtil.ScaleType scaleType,
                                                  int destW,
                                                  int destH,
                                                  int srcW,
                                                  int srcH)
        Generates sampling factor for BitmapFactory.Options.inSampleSize according to the passed ScaleType.

      • scale

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap scale(android.graphics.Bitmap src,
                            BmpUtil.ScaleType scaleType,
                            int w,
                            int h)
        More advanced scaling than simple Bitmap.createScaledBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap, int, int, boolean).

        Method will create totally new Bitmap, and the source Bitmap will stay safe (Bitmap.recycle() won't be called). So, if you don't need the source Bitmap after scaling, you should manually call Bitmap.recycle() for better memory usage.

        Parameters:
        src - source image for scaling
        scaleType - scaling option
        w - target image width
        h - target image height
        Returns:
        scaled image
        See Also:
        subsample(byte[], ru.jango.j0util.BmpUtil.ScaleType, int, int), scale(byte[], ru.jango.j0util.BmpUtil.ScaleType, int, int), Bitmap.createScaledBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap, int, int, boolean), Bitmap.recycle()

      • rotate

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap rotate(android.graphics.Bitmap src,
                             BmpUtil.ScaleType scaleType,
                             int degrees)
        More advanced rotation than with help of Matrix. After rotation source image could be automatically scaled according to the passed scaleType; width and height of the source image will be treated as target width and height for scaling.

        scaleType could be NULL, than the image would be just rotated without any post scaling.

        Method will create totally new Bitmap, and the source Bitmap will stay safe (Bitmap.recycle() won't be called). So, if you don't need the source Bitmap after rotation, you should manually call Bitmap.recycle() for better memory usage.
        Parameters:
        src - source image for rotation
        scaleType - scaling option, may be NULL
        degrees - rotation angle in degrees
        Returns:
        rotated image
        See Also:
        Bitmap.recycle()

      • resolveScale

        protected static android.graphics.PointF resolveScale(BmpUtil.ScaleType scaleType,
                                   int destW,
                                   int destH,
                                   int srcW,
                                   int srcH)
        Wrapper for BmpUtil.ScaleType.resolveScale(int, int, int, int), witch also checks bounds for MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE.
